channel.title: Teaching How To Update Your Server Without Restarting!
channel.description:
What we are adding today: http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/4470/clip0037.mp4
So if you figure this out, there will no longer be a need to completely annoy your players when making either big or small updates while your server is up, and its also instant which can really help with working on what needs to be done instead of waiting and rerunning. IF your unlucky and the status checkers check your server while making an update(hence being offline to rerun), you can lose uptime. With this, you are always online and making updates!
Im sure many of you have wondered how to do such a thing, and the best part is while you follow these directions carefully, you will make it through. Its not hard infact, its quite simple.
The key to this tutorial is a simple tool named J(ava) Rebel. This nifty tool is he main base for what we are trying to achieve throughout this tutorial, it does all the behind the scenes work while I teach you how to implement it into your source. This will require simple editting of an XML file, so dont get scared if it looks too different, because its not. To download jRebel, proceed here, http://www.zeroturnaround.com/jrebel/download/
After downloading it run the installer and remember were it installed. After installing an application will popup, this is used to help you configure jRebel. If you may, you can look over the entire thing and try to figure it out, and if you cant dont worry because I will get right to the point (note I didnt have an application like that to help, I downloaded the JAR).
Lets begin, reviewing the install path mine was, [QUOTE]C:\Program Files (x86)\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar[/QUOTE]
On my computer and probably many others, newly installed applications go into the Program Files (x86) folder, however yours might be different.
Now we are actually going to do something. Go into the source you wish to use jRebel with, and create a new XML file named rebel.xml. Next off open up the new XML file and place the following inside: [CODE]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <application xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.zeroturnaround.com" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.zeroturnaround.com/alderaan/rebel-2_0.xsd"> <classpath fallback="default"> <dir name="PATHTOSOURCE"> </dir> </classpath> </application> [/CODE]
This is where you need to do some editting. Where it says PATHTOSOURCE is obviously where you need to place the complete path to your server source. Heres an example:
[CODE]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <application xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.zeroturnaround.com" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.zeroturnaround.com/alderaan/rebel-2_0.xsd"> <classpath fallback="default"> <dir name="C:\Users\Anthony Calandra\Desktop\Java\317 Source"> </dir> </classpath> </application> [/CODE] Easy huh.
The, (or similar) [code] java -cp . -Xmx500m Server [/code]
in your run batch file gets replaced by, [code] java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel" server [/code]
But wait! Dont get too confident. Remember when I asked you to remember the path to where jRebel installed to? Well this is where you need to recall where it installed to. You need to also provide the complete path to the jrebel.jar file. Like so, [QUOTE] C:\Program Files (x86)\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar [/QUOTE]
Remember that is just an example and your will/might be different.
To actually use it just turn on your newly editted batch file (I mean runserver.bat or run.bat, etc.) and whenever you make changes simply open up your compiler and jRebel will automatically detect changes and apply them without having to restart anything. Heres a small video,
http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/4470/clip0037.mp4
It reloads the classes in your source after they are compiled, so obviously you cant go around expecting it works with CFG. Anyhow, I really hope you enjoy this!
~ Project Evolution ~ Creators of jRebel (Thanks)

item.title: Teaching How To Update Your Server Without Restarting!
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Invalidname:

need a crack for jrebel

Try using the social jrebel license, I don’t think there is a trial.

If you need the run code for 562 on a vps just do something like this:

screen -A -m -d -S rsps java -noverify -javaagent:"../jrebel/jrebel.jar" -Xms520m -classpath bin:deps/* com.rs2hd.Main servaddr 127.0.0.1

Read full topic
item.source: Teaching How To Update Your Server Without Restarting!

item.title: Teaching How To Update Your Server Without Restarting!
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnu2day, post:103, topic:339333”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=435716.msg3961165#msg3961165 date=1333302882]

Ok I finally got it, and im gonna post this for users who have 667/704 server.

64 Bit Code:

@echo off title Your Server Name echo Your Server is starting... java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files (x86)\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause exit

32 Bit Code:

@echo off title Your Server Name echo Your Server is starting... java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause exit

Please ++Rep++ Me For Trying To Figure This On My Own And Giving It Out To People Who Have 667/704 Server.

[im g]http://media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m109h1COP91qgdhlk.jpg[/img]

Don’t ask for rep, and modifying your compiler & starter is simple.
[/quote]

Actually there is no rule on asking for rep. I helped people with 667/704 servers, so I ask for ++Rep++. If you think I don’t deserve it then just don’t rep me at all and don’t say anything at all.[/quote]I see you read the rules. Good job.

Read full topic
item.source: Teaching How To Update Your Server Without Restarting!

@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“ipwnu2day, post:99, topic:339333”][size=24pt][font=arial]OMFG CAN SOME ONE PLEASE FUCKING FIX THIS!??!?!!?!?!?!?[/font][/size]

@echo off title Infinity-Break Server echo Infinity-Break Server is starting... "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\jrebel.jar" server pause exit

PLEASE HELP ME![/quote]

item.title: Teaching How To Update Your Server Without Restarting!
item.dc:creator: @abtekk abtekk
item.description:
@abtekk wrote:

I’ve got 2 issues here if anyone could help me: (This is a PI server)

My original runserver:

@echo off
title Mem leak fix

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1300m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

pause

My runserver when jRebel is added:

title InsidiaX
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1300m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar" server
pause

and now it’s outcome


C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak>title InsidiaX

C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak>"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\java.
xe" -Xmx1300m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;
eps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
The system cannot find the path specified.

C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak>java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Fil
s\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar" server

#############################################################

 JRebel 4.6.1 (201203151508)
 (c) Copyright ZeroTurnaround OU, Estonia, Tartu.

 Over the last 1 days JRebel prevented
 at least 0 redeploys/restarts saving you about 0 hours.

 This product is licensed to Lewis Cowtippin-melonballs Smith
 for non-commercial use only.

 The following plugins are disabled at the moment:
 * Apache MyFaces plugin (set -Drebel.myfaces_plugin=true to enable)
Reloads JSF configuration and reconfigures managed beans.
 * Click plugin (set -Drebel.click_plugin=true to enable)
Reloads menu.xml menu definitions of Apache Click projects.
 * JRuby Plugin (set -Drebel.jruby_plugin=true to enable)
 * Jersey plugin (set -Drebel.jersey_plugin=true to enable)
Reloads Jersey configuration from Java annotations.
 * Oracle ADF Core plugin (set -Drebel.adf_core_plugin=true to enable)
JRebel ADF Core Plugin
 * Oracle ADF Faces plugin (set -Drebel.adf_faces_plugin=true to enable)
JRebel ADF Faces Plugin
 * Seam-Wicket plugin (set -Drebel.seam_wicket_plugin=true to enable)
Integration with load time weaving seam annotations to wicket classes
(-javaagent:<path-to-jboss-seam-wicket-jar>)
 * WebObjects plugin (set -Drebel.webobjects_plugin=true to enable)
WebObjects JRebel Plugin

#############################################################

JRebel: Directory 'C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak\src\server' will be mo
itored for changes.
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
Could not find the main class: server.  Program will exit.

C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak>pause
Press any key to continue . . .

Once I got it to work, it said this:


JRebel: Directory 'C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak\src\server' will be mon
itored for changes.
JRebel: SUCCESS: Acquired a new off-line license token.
[01/04/12 01:35]: Launching ReactionX- G Wishart & Nathan
[01/04/12 01:35]: [ObjectDef] DONE LOADING OBJECT CONFIGURATION
[01/04/12 01:35]: [Region] DONE LOADING REGION CONFIGURATIONS
[01/04/12 01:35]: Exception in thread "main" [01/04/12 01:35]: java.lang.NoClass
DefFoundError: org/apache/mina/transport/socket/nio/SocketAcceptor
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at server.Server.main(Server.java:143)
[01/04/12 01:35]: Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.mina.t
ransport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Me
thod)
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown So
urce)
[01/04/12 01:35]:       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
[01/04/12 01:35]:       ... 1 more
[01/04/12 01:35]: Saving players...

C:\Users\rsps\Desktop\RSTweak\RSTweak>pause
Press any key to continue . . .

Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

Jrebel works great with a dropbox combination between developers, however I would not pay for the service nor do I think it’s worth it in the end.

Most IDEs come with a debug mode where you can do almost the same concept (update logic etc without restarting.)

item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“johnl17, post:86, topic:339333”]Sorry for the bump, but how would i get it to work with my run.bat?

@echo off title InsidiaX "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause[/quote]
I think:

title InsidiaX
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel" server
pause
